alert.note: Alert for Dalton Highway Summits; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 29 at 1:02AM AKST until January 30 at 12:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT AKST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow with low visibility expected and very cold wind chills expected. Total snow accumulations up to 4 inches. Visibility one half mile or less at times. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Very cold wind chills to 55 below. * WHERE...Dalton Highway Summits. * WHEN...Until midnight AKST tonight. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. Areas of blowing snow will reduce visibility. Snow drifts will form. Wind chills to 55 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Northeast winds are causing wind chills to 55 below now. Snow moving north over the area this morning along with increasing northeast winds will cause blowing snow with low visibility that will continue into tonight. Temperatures will rise today and make wind chills less severe.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Dalton Highway Summits; White Mountains and High Terrain South of the Yukon River
